description: Modern scientific work relies heavily on electronic circuitry and computation.  This course examines
the fundamentals of analog and digital electronics, explores the applications of discrete and
integrated circuits, and introduces the broad topic of computer control of experiments.  Students
develop hands-on skills in circuit building, computer interfacing, and programming in LabViewÂ®.
Students attend one laboratory period each week.  Prerequisite: Physics 125 or 131.  Offered
